column4: Blank: So then I went onto the docs, and went through the steps, tried the auto-detect first... then I went googling for my hori and vert for my monitor.
Blank, Bruenig: I understand how it works now. The lack of gui was really what made it tough. And hasseling with VI.
Blank: Yeah, only gave me the 640x480 option.
Blank: The odd thing is, it detected my monitor's refresh at 50 when it was supposed to be 75.
Blank: So I googled and found the proper vertrefresh and horisync... and then modified the xorg.conf, and made a backup in case it breaks.
Blank: Yeah. :) After hassling with it, I've gotten it working. I feel accomplished.
Now I need to figure out how to get my Plantroics DSP-500 working.
I kind of like having sound...
So... does anyone have suggestions about how to get my DSP-500 plantronics headset working?
I've done a little bit of googling, but most of it is inconclusive. Actually, that's how my config got messed up in the first place, trying to install the DSP-500.
what are you trying to get it run in?
works in windows is an insulting comment
if you would like assistance, I can help, I use those all day long
Xorg has nothing to do with your headset, hold on a minute, thanks
back
so you want it to work in xmms, is it plugged in?
lspci | plant
im assuming your fairly intelligent :)
lsusb | grep Plant
you should assuming im intelligent as well :/
you should see the Planttronics listed
